Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, huge clean rooms, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelmum3
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we we booked 2 rooms and stayed for 5 nights. The hotel was situated in an excellent location, at the top of the Ramblas and a 2 minute walk to Catyluna Sqaure. The rooms were huge, one room had balcony and overlooked the beauiful street and the other room over looked the pool. The rooms were spotless and the beds quite comfortable. The reception staff were helpful when you could get their attention, a lot of people standing there busy talking to each other... Only negative aspects were poor internet and expensive breakfast. One room had no internet connection at all despite there being supposed free wifi. If wifi is important then avoid room 426.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: keen_traveller495
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and didn't regret we chose this hotel. The location is central, right near the Ramblas. The room was clean, big and comfortable. Breakfast is good, especially coffee. They serve excellent coffee at the hotel. The reception was polite and quick in putting us into the room, however we had early check in. So I do recommend this hotel for a comfortable vacation or short escape in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent breakfast.. but the rest..”
Reviews.Author: lyba
Reviews.Content: good location, excellent breakfast, but the hotel you can forget.. small rooms, unpolite staff, realy no place i appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: reviewer186534
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Catalonia ramblas and would thoroughly recommend to anyone. The hotel is a 2 min walk from plaza catalunya which is a popular area in the city. We found the room to be very nice, only issue I had was a lack of power sockets and no mirror next to dressing table area. The spa was beautiful, would recommend anyone staying to find some time to visit it. Beautiful pool. Sauna and steam room. The bar was nice, reasonably priced. A great location for city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend break”
Reviews.Author: RogerKaren
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very welcoming and warm, a quick efficient check-in. Location ideal for all sight seeing purposes. Breakfast buffet was superb with endless choice available. Made use of the hotel spa facilities which was included in the price, very enjoyable and made our weekend. Highly recommended, would book again without a second thought!!

Reviews.Title: “Short Break To Catalonia Ramblas Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: barranceshirley
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Catalonia Ramblas, Barcelona, Spain last month (March2012). It was a special occassion as we had just got married. When we booked the hotel it was requested we had a nice room as it was a special occassion. On arrival our room was small & not what we had expected, I was very upset. I went to reception and explained the situation to them, within 30 minutes we were moved to a wonderfull large room. The room had 2 balconies, a huge bed and so,so spacious. All the staff at the hotel were fantastic, so polite & friendly. The breakfast was so varied, there was something for everyone. The bar was well stocked & good cocktails. The spa & pools are brilliant too. This hotel is in a fantastic location, just off Ramblas which is where you would want to be. So easy to get there from the airport & once there everywhere is within easy reach. We enjoyed our stay so much at this hotel I would recommend it to anyone looking for a holiday to Barcelona. Thank you so much to all the staff at this hotel, you are great & made our stay there memorable. We will be back for another stay with you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JanSkjoy
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hotel and must say it was a great pleasure. Although the staff in the reception was not excellent and not too friendly, this did not spoil our vacation. We stayed in a Junior Suite with private pool and enjoyed the stay immense. Afternoon in the pool with a cold beer or cava made the day perfect. Also perfect location for the Rambla, metro and tourist buses gave us a great starting point for all our days. We would also point out the service and friendliness of the guy serving breakfast in the bar. Very good quality and positive person. One tip to the hotel. Invest in toilet brushes for the rooms - honestly!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary price quality relation. best restaurant in town!!”
Reviews.Author: Federico H
Reviews.Content: last saturday we went to Restaurant Pelai after a friend's recomendation and indeed, it was a gorgeous experience!! i totally recomend it. City center prime area, nice decoration, excellent Service, good wine celler, excellent food quality and the best is that the we were expecting much higher prices for that quality/service. To sum up: excellent !!

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel one of the best I've stayed in in Europe”
Reviews.Author: muadib1158
Reviews.Content: All told I've probably spent 6 months in hotels across Europe. This is probably the nicest I've ever stayed in during all of that time. I will clarify that statement to say that I've stayed in some cheapo hotels and some nice business traveler hotels, but not "luxury" hotels. Clean, well staffed and a great location. I would definitely stay here again if I were traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wide range from Excellent to just Awful”
Reviews.Author: savtashira
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an odd mixture of great - but really great and worse than awful. Catalonia Ramblas is a very modern and clean hotel. It's situation was perfect within walking distance to everything. The room was very very big and lovely big beds and parquet floors. We overlooked the pool so we never heard a hint of traffic. The beds were very big and easy to move. Breakfast was extensive with lots of fresh fruits, delicious pastries, good cappuccino etc etc. The dining room staff was very friendly and obliging. Free Wifi was welcomed change to usually high costs in hotels. But, unfortunately we had problems with the bath room. There was a very bad stench of sewer in the toilet. When I brought this to their attention on the first morning, they explained that when it rains in Barcelona, there is a sewer problem. OK, as we say "[--] Happens" Anyway we spent very little time in the room. There is also a large door between the toilette area and the bedroom, so the odor didn't permeate to our area at night. The other problem was the shower. There was no way we could adjust the water. Either it was scalding hot or freezing cold. All this without touching the faucettes. Showers were a nightmare. My room mate was in tears. They offered to change rooms, but when we checked, they were all the same problem with the water temperature. Usually, I am not the one to complain, but our experience in the hotel was definitely soured by the toilet and shower. We went to the manager and as compensation, they allowed us late check out free of charge and also didn't charge for the dinner we had one night. I must say they were very forth coming. Other small problems we had was the hairdryer. The covering always fell off, exposing the wires. The bed sagged, causing one to slip to the side. There was virtually no place to put clothes apart from the hanging closet. I had to remove the coffee/tea shelf and leave things there. But, I wouldn't go back without assurance that the problems I mentioned were fixed. When I read Trip advisor, this was a re-occurring comment by other travelers. The 4th floor was mentioned as problematic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: marianneBL
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the hotel. Clean, big room, great bathroom, great beds, Good free wifi. The location is perfect, very central in good area. Very easy to find and close to airport bus. Unfortunately, the gym and spa is opening very late and therefore I didn't try. Did not try breakfast/restaurant. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Did have problems with hot water but it was dealt with immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nyreesummerof69
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a little expensive, but I don't want it to seem negative. Location was brill very close to everything great bus shuttle service to and from airport. Breakfast was amazing great choice. Rooms were clean and a good size although a little noisy I wouldn't say they were sound proof, photos on website are a true reflection of the hotel. Staff at reception were helpful. Internet not good connection in some rooms but available in lobby area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flynn_joe
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a short break to Barcelona with friends. We stayed at this hotel following reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is sited at the top of La Rambla by Placa da Catalunya, a very central spot, perfect for the tourist buses and for sightseeing. Our room was spotless, large and we loved the bathroom, which was huge. Our balcony looked down onto a typical Barcelona narrow street, very atmospheric. Breakfast was set in a large dining room, where you could choose something different every day and it was all tried by our party and all was very tasty! We did not try the spa or pool but they looked great and had it been August, very inviting. Bar area small but lovely with attentive waiters. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of weeks ago and it really exceeded my expectations, based on the price and location. The hotel was calm and quiet inside, despite being just off Ramblas, and the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. My room was huge! It was also very quiet, clean, well stocked and the bed really comfortable - I had a great night's sleep. I would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in that part of Barcelona and will certainly be coming back myself. My colleagues were equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional staff, perfect location, recently updated, somewhat loud.”
Reviews.Author: Mowgliw
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Barcelona for business and was very happy with my hotel choice. The staff was unfailingly professional and courteous at all times. The room was very comfortable with generous amenities (both a European and an enormous rain shower). The location was far enough away from the Ramblas to avoid most of the crowds, but close enough to stop by for a visit. Two very close subway stops were very convenient. A cash machine just outside allows one to get cash out and stores in the room safe without walking around. The one night that I ordered room service was quite tasty. The only complaint would be that folks in this area of Barcelona party all hours of the night and my room on the ground in the back overlooked a street that was traversed by singing drunks one evening at 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oke79
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 4 nights for a break before our baby is born..... What a mistake! The hotel is situated in a great location and the rooms are ok, that's where the positive's end. The staff are the most arrogant people we have ever come across and the most unhelpful people in the world. When we arrived our room was not ready so the lady at reception suggested we upgrade to a suite which includes lots of extra services for an additional 30 euros per night, so we did........... The extra services were..... A pair of paper slippers and an xxl dressing gown!!! This extra service would have infact cost us 120 euros! We then changed back to a standard double which was almost identicle, minus the slippers and dressing gown! The menu in the restaurant is fine if you enjoy the more extreme side of Spanish/French food but not for the fain hearted! The 'gym' is a joke! It's an old tred mill and 2 old bikes in a broom cupboard and the spa is shocking and dangerous! All in all this stay was way over priced and the hotel is no way near 4* standard especially the service. It is a shame as I'm sure run properly this could be a fantastic hotel. The hotel also does not really cater for its English speaking guests and the staff speak limited English which makes its hard to even complain or get your point across. Please,please, please do not get fooled by the look of the hotel as its is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefania m
Reviews.Content: location fantastic but no noisy, near the ramblas many bar and restaurants and good shops . the rooms are very big and contortable clean ,big beds , tv plasma with italian channel bathroom with boisery and separate shower . the breakfast isnt included but not expencive. hotel assistents, barman very polite and disponible. good rates, free wifi in each rooms

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: adeelfrajput
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, safe, superb service, very clean, excellent price, free wi-fi, Location is superb, right in the centre of the city, 1 min walk to la rambles and catanya, did not have breakfast so cannot comment on that however not a bad thing to say about the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sohail M
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer Sevice by all staff especially Leticia. Everyone was very helpful. We also got a complimentary upgrade. Overall great experience. We were there Dec 30 2012

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JW1023
Reviews.Content: The check-in process took a long time. I think it took us 30 mins at least to get checked in. The staff, particularly a certain Dani, was not helpful at all. He was stationed at the reception. We needed to reconfirm a tour booking and we approached him to ask him if he could reconfirm the tour details for us. His reply was absurd, that he was not authorized to call and that we should call the tour company ourselves. Moreover, he said he could find the reference code to quote the tour operator. Um, well, the reference code is there on the voucher we had printed. Eventually, he did call the tour company and reconfirmed the booking.. But his customer service skills are clearly lacking. It appeared to me like he did not want the hassle of calling the tour company. The rooms LOOK nice and modern and hip, but the functionality needs repair. The aircon thermostat didn't work, for it was only set at 24 degrees. You couldnt change it. In the bathroom, the water pressure was weak. The shower thermostat was flaky, for sometimes it was too hot, then too cold. My wife almost got burnt a few times trying to regulate the temperature of the shower water. The shower tub drain needed de- logging because the tub also flooded when we took a shower. There was even one night when all the water in the bathroom was hot, and this happened when my wife was in the middle of taking a shower! She couldnt rinse herself because of the hot water. She almost burned her face trying to rinse the shampoo from her hair. We couldn't find the lukewarm temp of the water. The water in the sink was hot too, even when you set the thermostat to the max cold position. For the breakfast times, the restaurant opened at 730 am. This was not good for us since we had tours that started at 9, so we had to rush our eating so as not to be late for the tour. They should start breakfast times earlier, during weekends. Avoid this hotel at all costs. This hotel is superficial. It looks nice and all, but inside it, you'll find the cracks and flaws. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gercumberton
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 9 females arriving at approx. 9:30 p.m. I had requested 3 twin rooms and 1 triple and was delighted that we got what we requested. The rooms were superior, hotel very quiet and clean. Breakfast was superb, we spent our first morning 1.5 hours enjoying the very spacious restaurant and very fresh varied foods available.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated!”
Reviews.Author: Salome P
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Lovely Hotel, lovely room, friendly staff, free internet. Close to everything. The only problem is that the rooms and corridors are not carpeted(marble and wood) so the noise from people talking and pulling their suitcases can be a little noisy. Otherwise it was a good experiece. If you are a 1st time visitor to Barcelona, be carefull of pickpockets! They stole our bag from under our feet in a Restaurant! Police were very helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “good hosting in catalonia ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Barak D
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel in January this year for 4 nights - my wife, 2 children & me. We took the superior room, the room was big with 2 1.2 meter beds. there is a sofa as well but it is not to comfort. they gave us additional mattress but it wasn't comfortable. the shower is perfect - bath and a shower. the crue is very plesent. they have spa as well but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Penelope745
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona for a short break. Stayed in the Catalonia Ramblas for the one night. The room and its en-suite were very comfortable, clean and spacious. As we arrived late evening, we decided to eat in and what a superb meal we had, the food was delicious, the service very good and the price very reasonable. Breakfast was an extensive buffet, something for everyone. All staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would definitely stay here again if we revisit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: Central location was a great spot. The Suite was lovely and highly recommend the Suite with a terrace - we had lovely mornings relaxing in the sun on the terrace. The restaurant served great food at a reasonably price. It was comfortable and easy going stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: chaitov
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience in this hotel. We didn't expect such a comfortable, modern, totally renewed room. We enjoyed the space, the huge bed, the shower, the coffee table and the cute terrace to the street. You can't ask for a better location, near Placa Catalonya and the Las Ramblas. The most central Metro station is 3 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel was very clean and the service at the reception was excellent at all times. We took no breakfast, so I can't say anything about it. We stayed in the hotel during the winter, and were happy to find out there's a small spa, for free. Enjoyed the mini-pool / Jacuzzi and the Sauna. The rooms are equipped with a TV, mini-bar, electronic kettle (with coffee, tea, sugar, etc.) and an electronic safe.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: Central and quite spot, nice spa and amazing staff. Very close to Ramblas and I pretty enjoyed the pool area where you can make a lot of friends. With respect to its quality and service, the price is fairly reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Linworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Barcelona for 3 days, wanted something central. Hotel is in the middle of everything. Can't fault it's location. Did have a few issues wtih housekeeping. Mold in shower and bath floors in the corners had dust and build up. Leak in ceiling by rain shower and under vanity. Someone had spilt something on the wall under the desk. It dried and was never cleaned up. Food tray in the hall for 3 days. Gym was open all the time only open when spa was open . Odd hours.On the up side. Breakfast was good. Superior room was large. Nice linens on bed. Mattress was firm. Lighting was good. Wish they had a mirror in the room, that way 2 people could get ready at the same time. I would call this a superor 3 star, not a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: mayankak
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona on the 23rd November stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is centrally located everything is close by and at walking distance. The hotel is good with a good spread of buffet breakfast, only the hotel needs to improve in the house keeping section. Unfortunately we had to change our room twice since the room on the 4 th floor in the wing facing the main street was smelling of sewage, we then moved onto the 1st floor, which was much better. But over all good stay and a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to start your sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: Alebir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good situated for sightseeing close to the Ramblas and the old City and lots of restaurants in every prize classes.

Reviews.Title: “Was charged twice for the stay - 4 months later still waiting to get the money back”
Reviews.Author: oceanemn
Reviews.Content: 1st thing i would like to say about this hotel is that at time of payment the reception staff told me that my card was not working and assured me the payment by card did not go through so I went to get some cash from a bank just outside the hotel and paid cash. When I got home I checked my bank account and realised the payment by credit card worked. Which meant I paid twice, once by card, once by cash. I have been in contact with the hotel for nearly four months who say that they know there is an issue and they are taking care of it but I still haven't been paid back. Appart from that, the rooms are nice and comfy (but a little nosy on the pool side - as there is bar), breakfast is expensive but good. It is nice to have a swimming pool but a little small and it was difficult to get a sunbed during the afternoon. For visiting very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maxico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre cruise. Last time we stayed at the Ramblas Hotel ( never again). Caught the aerobus from the airport to plaza Catalunya and a short walk to the hotel from there.The Catalonia Ramblas is a huge improvement on the last one we stayed in, although it should be for the price we paid.Check in was easy and the staff helpful and polite.Our room was large,modern and clean. We had a room at the rear and it was very quiet even though it was next to the lift.Wifi is free and works well although it is not suitable for skype. The hotel is in an excellent location and if you can get it for a good price it is good value

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, good breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: Trygve A
Reviews.Content: I don't know the price my company paid for us staying there, but the service was good, the location excellent, the air-condition worked well (a little noisy, but I didn't mind), the breakfast was good, and it looked good. If anything, it is not so easy to orient in the hotel, as it seems to be made up of several refurnished buildings, in stead of one from the start. Overall though, I would definitely recommend this hotel (unless the price is too steep of course).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: If you want to explore the city - this is a perfect place to stay. It is located minutes from Rambla Canaletes, Plaza Catalunia and Exiample, yet being quiet to ensure your good night sleep. The rooms are modern and nice, they could only be a bit more spacious and there are no drawers. Breakfast is great, nice variety, even an omelette station. I didn't get a chance to try their outside pool, but it looked very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: rollonemptynest
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 2 night stay in the Catalonia Ramblas prior to a cruise. You really could not ask for a better location. Located just a short few paces from Plaza Catalunya, Las Ramblas and the beautiful gothic quarter. The beautiful old facade of the old building belies the modern, comfortable interior. Breakfast was plentiful from the buffet and of excellent quality. Very friendly and welcoming front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, with some issues”
Reviews.Author: wesz
Reviews.Content: My overall opinion is that the hotel is good, well positioned, clean, popular, but I had some minor issues, which is not really acceptable in a 4* hotel. These were: 1. One morning I was surprised by a coakroach in the bathroom. Some pest control please. 2. The size of the TV is ridicoulus, if you have money for hardwood floors, white furnitures, and marble in the bathroom, why can't you invest into a 32inch TV? 3. The front desk staff is unorganized, they do their job, but there are some issues on the friendliness front. A smile coulc help a lot. 4. Lats evening I got a "love" letter from the management, asking me to approach the mighty front desk, because nobody can owe more than 600EUR at one time. Obviously I wasn't the only one naughty guy, some other victims were also standing there. The only issues I had were the following: We paid the room on that morning full, just stayed one more night, but it was paid as well. Guys, you got my Credit Card on file, why didn't you put an option on it, or charged it? Thats why you have it. Instead bother me, order me to the front desk and not even saying that you were sorry. Otherwise the hotel is clean, good bed, nice interior design, coffee / tea maker, but somehow that added value, or nice touch is missing. It's a management issue.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice, especially for its location”
Reviews.Author: Athens_Traveler15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catalonia Ramblas only for one night on a business trip. The hotel was very descent, the rooms were well-furnished, quiet and spacious enough. The food was good and the staff was polite. Also, the business center and convention rooms were good, not the best you can find but reasonably good. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is very close to the Las Ramblas avenue, which goes up and down the downtown area of Barcelona and can lead you to both the modern and the old (medieval) central part of the city. The hotel's location gives you the opportunity to do a quick site seeing tour (Gaudi buildings and the medieval part of the old city) and/or some good quality shopping, even if you only have a couple of hours to spend. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wont stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie55
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 6 ladies and booked 3 twin rooms, we booked in March and made a specific request for twin rooms, on arrival we were given 3 rooms close together which was good, one room was as requested the other two were cramped and had double beds. We requested twin rooms and were told they only had one avaliable the hotel was full, eventually after insistance they found what they called an upgraded room, this was 2 floors up but was ok, although difficult to see what the upgrade had different. The rooms on the ground floor had very little natural light and were very dark. Our room had a bathroom opposite a seating area and the blind was so inadequate we could be seen sat on the toilet, and also in the shower, which was so basic directing the jet correctly was impossible, by rooms to the side of us. The pool are was small with a very poor outlook/surroundings,as usual witha city hotel, it was overtaken completely by a large rowdy crowd all the time we were there and the drinks were very expensive. The spa was closed. The hotel is contemporary if dark and very clean, the staff were very helpful, especially in the restaurant, and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: KristianR
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. Worked really well. Good rooms and a good breakfast. Very central. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: InesTa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July and we choose the hotel for its location, which is great indeed, and for the swimming pool, good at the end of a hot day... Unfortunately, the swimming pool was very small and very crowded. The room with extra bed is extremely small. Breakfast is good. The staff is ok.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT, ENJOYED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: Romioo
Reviews.Content: After having hard time in the hotel our agent booked IN BARCELONA DOWNTOWN, we decided to move to this hotel. The employees at the reception welcomed us with a big smile that did not leave their faces until we left. "EVA" AT THE RECEPTION IS VERY HELPFUL AND PROFESSIONAL. A nice lady that guided us by herself to check the room before booking. THE room is fantastic and ABSOULETLY CONFORTAMBLE with a double glass window for a quite stay. SERVICE IS GREAT. JUST NEED TO ADD VARIETIES TO BREAKFAST.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive, for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Pro89
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its location and in that respect the hotel was pretty good. I paid for the standard room and after seeing the Junior Suite with pool, decided to upgrade by paying an extra 70 euros. The room was located on the new 7th floor, and there were no bell boys, so you had to carry your own luggage to your room. This was further complicated by the fact that the hotel lifts did not serve the floor. The room was pretty spacious and the wooden deck terrace and paddle pool was a nice touch. Aside from these external extras, everything else about the room was pretty much identical to a typical room. The beds were not particularly comfortable (too hard), but the rest of the furniture in the room was pretty good, especially the sofa and the 50 inch plasma television. The bathroom and its layout was excellent. There is a Jacuzzi bath tub and a separate rainfall shower room. The toilet was located in a separate part of the room. The shower water temperature kept fluctuating during my stay which was disappointing. The main problem I had with the suite was that the pool in the terrace was tiny, not heated and had no lighting. This is contradictory to the website photos, which clearly showed the pool having underwater lights. The seating area was very poorly lit, which meant it was virtually impossible to enjoy any of the outdoor facilities after dark, which is disappointing considering the extra money I paid for the privileges. The standard of English amongst the receptionists also fluctuated massively. Laura at the front desk was excellent, and really went out of her way to help me choose a good room, but a bloke I had the pleasure of speaking to, couldn’t actually speak English and kept apologising. I found this rather bizarre, as most guests, as like many other hotels in Barcelona tend to be occupied by English speaking guests. Despite being marketed as a luxury hotel, there was something very budget about it. I can’t quite put my finger on it, but I reckon it might be a combination of the so-so service, inconsistent hotel design (some floors were very modern and swanky, others were run down) and questionable maid service (a platter of rotten fruit was left outside my room by another guest for several days). Nonetheless, the Catalonia Ramblas has been one of the better hotels I have stayed at in Barcelona, and should they make their prices more competitive it would be very hard for me not to consider staying here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lucygemma
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a great location short walk to metro and all attractions,the room was very clean ,no draw space,shower in room 441 was pretty bad no presssure and temps kept going too hot and too cold,not enough pressure to wash hair.the price we paid we thought breakfast should have been included..the swimming pool was very small and only 12 sunbeds which where taken by 9am quite disappointed with it .we did sleep well no problem with noise in all a good stay,thebeds where very hard but we slept well after a lot of walking and seeing such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A urban oasis in the most overcroweded street of the city”
Reviews.Author: Xaviermartin
Reviews.Content: We were surprised about finding a restaurant with an inside patio in one of the streets with the heaviest traffic and activity of the city. The service was outstanding and the food was also very good. It is not a cheap place, but we got a bonus of extra energy with the relaxing atmosphere of the place that accompanied the healthy grilled dishes we enjoyed. That helped us cope with the chaos outside the patio's door!

Reviews.Title: “WORST COSTUMER SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: Lissethp
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and I stayed in Catalonia ramblas for a week and a half, when we left for the airport back to the states, the taxi driver left one of our suitcases in the hotel lobby, we didn’t realized about the suitcase till we arrived in Atlanta, from that point on i tried to get any help from the hotel to send me my suitcase, the first thing they said to me when i called them was, isn’t our responsibility to deal with it since you already checked out, from that point on,they will tell me they will find a shipping company to send it to me, but it never happened, after 2 weeks, i will call and they wouldn’t even talk to me anymore, we ended up contacting one of my husbands ex-co worker from Afghanistan that lives in Barcelona and begged him to help us out, he came to the hotel and picked up my bag.....We are still in shock on how they simply didn’t care about us, our situation and desperation to fix the problem. I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ROOM, WOULD RECOMMEND SUITE TO ANYONE.”
Reviews.Author: jess_234_x
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, i booked a junior suite. From the pictures on the internet i did not have much high hopes for this and i was a little concerned. However upon our arrival, we had arrived before 2pm therefore we had to wait a couple of hours before the room was ready, but we didnt mind as we had a look around Barcelona down las ramblas. When we returned to the hotel to obtain our room keys, as promised we got them. We got the lift up to floor 5 where our room was, we were very surprised, the room was by far better than expected it was very clean, modern, comfy! The bathroom was great, the shower was massive. Our balcony with a splash pool on and lounger made our holiday it was perfect. I am not sure what any of the other rooms are like but i would definitely recommend the suites at this hotel. We did not experience any of the food at this hotel as we ate out. The was expensive however i do not feel as though i have been ripped off as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Central Setting”
Reviews.Author: DaveEB310
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend 2 days and nights at the HOTELES CATALONIA (Ramblas) in Barcelona during a recent trip. We stayed in the Superior Terrace Rooms. The Hotel was clean and spotless, friendly, and offered beautiful large rooms in a downtown Barcelona Central Setting. Because of its central location we were able to walk most anywhere while exploring the wonderful architecture, people, food and cafes, and historical and cultural sights of Barcelona, Spain. The Hotel is located less than a 5 minute walk to the top of Las Ramblas and a large Plaza. Additionally, there are dining and shopping experiences immediately upon exiting the hotel. The Staff is friendly and multi-lingual. I attempted to use my Spanish abilities many times, but the English is so well-spoken by staff that speaking their language is almost difficult. The Hotel offered Free Water in the Rooms, as well as more importantly, FREE WI-FI. Even the Marriott charges a crazy Euro sum for an hour up to 24 hours when you stay in their Elite part of the hotel, near the Airport. I recommend the Catalonia Ramblas highly and should I ever get back to Barcelona I know exactly where we will stay! The Showers in our room were large (but the water is HOT), and the products provided the room are ample for every need. The Toilet is separate is another closed off area making it convenient for couples or a pair sharing the room. BTW...we did use the very clean and kept pool, which is located on a terrace outside the hotel in the back (and warm due to the direct sun), just outside the inside bar. You can get drinks and food options at the pool, as well as get some access to nice lounge furniture and cooling mist sprayers. Surrounding the pool area are residential buildings and apartments really providing a taste that you're in Barcelona. I found it quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugSFCA2005
Reviews.Content: We thought hotel had everything we wanted and we were willing to pay for a hotel that met all our needs. Well, we are paying quite high rates, in order to be close to everything, have a pool, good service, quite ... Well, here's what we got - outrageously high prices - check, good service - not at all (example: we showed up after hours of travel at 2:45 for a 2:00 check-in, room not ready for 2 more hours - zero help or accommodation), pool - check, but MUCH smaller than you expect from the photo, which was clearly taken with a distorting lens - maybe 10 Chairs fit around the pool - tiny and cold, Breakfast - ok, but NOT for 30 euro per person, quiet - NOPE - we were put in a room right off of the restaurant - we clearly stated we were coming with a 6 year old - loud until midnight and we could not open our window for safety reasons ... We were moved after the first night, which was good, but, of course a pain for us as we had to wait until the room was vacated that day and could not begin our adventures until the move.... But WORST of all ... The hotel seems to be a dorm and cafeteria for traveling student groups!!! They were up late - yelling in the halls, occupying all of the common spaces and dominating the breakfast room. We are unfortunately here for 6 nights (and will update if anything worsens or improves) - in my vast travel experience, when you book for 4+ or 5+ nights they usually offer discounts or free breakfast, etc... When I mentioned this upon arrival the staffer said 6 nights is nothing to us we have an entire group here for 22 nights and another just left - 22 nights also - huh? I queried - what kind of group is here 22 nights?? Students, he proudly told me, "so 6 nights would not get you free breakfast". I responded "well, I'm sure we're paying more". "oh yes, much much more"!!! Hmmmm.... Not the right thing to say to a (an over-paying) customer! Bottom line - if you want to subsidize a bunch of students and get to listen to them at night and hang with them all day stay here ... If that sounds repugnant to you, do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Monica0707
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a perfect location. Only about 3 mins walk to La Ramblas, close to metro and other tourist sites. Our spacious room was cleaned and toiletries topped up daily. Lovely swimming pool area for chilling and really nice spa (especially the jaccuzi). Had a ground floor room (not facing onto a street) with black out blinds so was not woken in the mornings. Also booked in advance so got a very good rate. Couldn't complain about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BabsPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Catalonia Ramblas and just loved it. We booked a Superior Room but were offered an upgrade to a Junior Suite which included buffet breakfast and late checkout for 55 euro extra. It was amazing. We had a huge, beautifully appointed room with our own sunroom, decking and pool. It was so lovely to relax after the hustle and bustle of Barcelona. The reception staff were so pleasant, the room was beautiful and was spotlessly clean and the location was perfect. We were only a short walk to all the action, close to the shops, but far enough away to be able to relax. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel in great location...”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel93
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night pre-cruise. About 25 minutes from the airport--we took a taxi to the hotel. I think it was 28Euros. Easy check-in. Rooms were clean, great bathrooms. Love the hardwood floors in the rooms. We had first floor rooms in the back which were very quiet. I would have liked a room on a higher floor--but we were only there for one night so it was fine. Loved the free WIFI. Nice pool/bar area between first and second floor. Included breakfast was very good. The location was perfect--1/2 block from Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalyuna. Easy Metro ride to Guell Park which is a must see! Our adult "children" did a "Talking Car Tour" on Sunday morning which they said is not to be missed. (you drive a little car around and it gives you directions and tells you about the sites you are seeing.) Overall, I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in the room”
Reviews.Author: Namme
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location and it was a nice place to stay although I met a cockroach in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: MnineM
Reviews.Content: Good: Location - almost on Plaça de Catalunya. Easy walk to Metro stations, bus, la Rambla. Backside rooms are on a quiet street. Center rooms may overlook the pool deck. Desk service - very good. Prompt response to room service request (Maid forgot to re-supply shampoo and leave clean wine glasses). While waiting my turn, I though they handled 2 back-to-back rude check-ins tactfully. Bellman was always in the right place at the right time (curb pick-up/ drop, storage, and offered carts to self-service guests). Breakfast - Staff always picking-up and clearing tables promptly while serving coffee and ensuring no empty food trays. Chat with the eggs-to-order person as she is personable. Good variety of bread and pastries, mellons, juice and ham variations. Pool - raised area a few steps above a sun deck and bar. On the 1 + level, outdoors between two wings. Spa area has a good size jacuzzi with waterfall. Free wifi with good speed for large photo and video uploads. Room safe big enough for a netbook, an older type camera that looks like a film camera, and my travel gnome statue. Set your own digital number lock. Bathroom - For Europe the bathroom is hugh. Sink with counter and shelves; tub; side by side toilet and bidet; Separate stall with overhead rain shower and wand spray. Could put many people in the shower- more room than most European lifts. Warning: At check-in pay attention to your room number and its wing and level location, else the number and locations of elevators and stairways will be a maze of confusion. Bad: Rain shower stall leaked under its door. Get extra towels for the floor. If you do not put out the make-up-the-room door hanger, it may not be ready if you return for a siesta. Although there was more than one day's supply of soap and shampoo at check-in day, we had to ask for more shampoo for our last day. And, one day the glassware was not replaced. If you go only for the Barcelona beach, this is the wrong part of the city. But, if the beach is on your to-do list, you can get there by metro and walking through the pleasant and interesting Barceloneta area.

Reviews.Title: “will never recommend to anybody”
Reviews.Author: solo025
Reviews.Content: I will start with good points about this hotel: nice and spacious room, free Wi-Fi in the room, central location, nice outdoor swimming pool area, though swimming pool itself is very small and the view from there is on ugly buildings around. However when it comes to service, it's very very bad... we asked for urgent laundry and were promised to have our items back in 2 hours but get them at the end after 6 hours of waiting, when we tried to ask the status, reception was just telling us that people in laundry went for lunch and they can't help us. Hotel claims that it has spa however when we went there, there was a sign "out of order". when we asked on reception, they told us that this is a regular maintenance work, so it was just closed without any notice. In a bar they don't know how to prepare the drinks they have in a menu. Overall, it's not 4* hotel, even though they charge for that. there are much better hotels in Barcelona for the same price, i would recommend to look for another options.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: guysa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and 3 nights in barcelona. From the very begining the staf was very helpful and made sure we get by. The room was very clean and big enough (the closet was not that big though). We didn't have a chance to test the pool but some couples that we met there seemed to enjoy it very much. Free Wifi in the room and lobby was very helpful. breakfest was fine , not enough vegtibles, but great orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything while far enough away to be quiet”
Reviews.Author: EuroTrip2011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, loved the pool - great way to cool off at the end of the day. We were upgraded and had fabulous rooms with a private patio. The staff were great. The breakfast in the hotel was very expensive, internet was not free - my only two complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beejerusa
Reviews.Content: Location, Location and Location We had a big room, a wonderful bathroom, the cleaning service was great. The staff is helpful and kind

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jarve-05
Reviews.Content: We didn't originally book here; were upgraded upon arriving at Catalonia Plaza Cataluna due to their own overbooking. It was a pleasant surprise to be switched to such a terrific hotel. A very convenient location for walking to most of the major sights. The room itself was spacious, wonderfully decorated, comfortable, and quiet. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey080 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Wanted a modern hotel with spa and found most places expensive for just a weekend break. This hotel was worth the money, very modern, clean, with nice helpful staff. The spa was lovely, with everything you need after a day of site seeing. The rooms were very spacious and although the beds were pushed together, they weren't two singles, more like two doubles together. Breakfast had every option available. I'd say 5* hotel definitely. The location was perfect, right near Las Ramblas and two metros, also a short walk from the airport bus stop. I found that Octopus was the cheapest website for prices and we got breakfast included for a cheaper price than other sites. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Ramblas Hotel is One Of A Kind! The best Hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: abenishay1
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the Catalonia Ramblas Hotel on the 13-17.03.11 and we were celebrate my wife 30 Birthday... The Catalonia Ramblas is in on word - Perfect!!! the Hotel Located on the Center of Barcelona (just 2 minutes by walking to the Placa Catalonia and the Ramblas Avenue). the hotel is look very nice out door and specially in door. the room is big, nice, warm, cozy, modern design with everything you need! the Breakfast was excellent with a very friendly staff! The most important thing on the Catalonia Ramblas Hotel and what makes him "One of a kind" is the amazing and friendly staff of the Hotel in generall!!! the staff at the the Reception (Mr.Joel, Ms.Laetitia, Ms.Anna and Mr.Markus) are very very friendly, warm people, they are smile all the time and allways want to help and assist you any way they can: Recommands for a good Resturants, Sites to visit, Flamenko Show, Pubs, Bars, Train / Metro time table, problem with the room or any other issue the guest may have... they are wonderfull people who smile all the time, they are most welcoming the guests and they give you the best feeling that you can get in order to make your stay plesent and fun as much as they can!!! For us they were amazing and they made our stay at the Hotel and the Vacation in Barcelona - Perfect!!! we will defenately will be back this Hotel again... However, I most to mentioned specially one of the Reception staff which was above evry one else - Mr.Joel Sanchez!!! From the very begining (before we even got to the Barcelona) Mr.Joel assist me in every way that he just could... He helped me to find and choose a very unique and good Resturant to celebarate my wife 30's Birthday and than he made the reservation for me at the resturant and he was very patient during all the prosess! when we were allready in the Hotel, Joel was magnificent and he assist us on evrything we wanted: the room, recommandations for a Resturants, Bars, Pubs, Site's to Visit, Train time table and many many other things! i can say now that Joel make our staying in Barcelona much much easier and plesent! Joel have a good heart, he is a very good person, patient, smart guy and trully want to help and assist you on every way that he can...For us - Joel is the Best Reception man / Hotel Staff that we have ever saw all over the world!!! We can only wish to our self in the future to bump into with many more Hotel Staff such as Mr.Joel Sanchez!!! Thank you Joel for all and for every thing you have done for us, you was unbelievable and amazing!!! We recommand on the Catalonia Ramblas Hotel in Barcelona with all of our heart - it is in 100% the best Hotel in Barcelona, just Perfect!!! The Catalonia Ramblas Hotel is definitely One Of A Kind!!! Bravo... Ami & Lilach Ben-Ishay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bornsenile
Reviews.Content: We paid a premium for the location for a short visit to Barcelona after their football world cup victory. As Gaudi fans on a tight timeline, we were happy with our choice as we go to see all the sights we had planned. The staff spoke good english and gave us some great tips on finding vegetarian food for my wife (always difficult in europe). The rooms were large and comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S WONDERFULֱֱֱ”
Reviews.Author: Natasha64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at catalonia ramblas for 4 nights. The decor is modern and nice. The rooms are big and comfortable(the matress is too tough)with kettle,refregerator,safe and free WIFI. But above all: the location is just perfect- we seldom used the metro-we got everywhwere by foot or taxi. You are always in center of town and things to do, just getting out of the front door. The staff are helpful.We enjoyed it-I bet you will too.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel surprised positively in every parameter!”
Reviews.Author: intertk
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited in Barcelona for 4 nights during 6-10/2/2011 with my sister's baby girl (5 months). We didn't know any hotel in that great city, so we made some "homework" by the intertnet and decided to go for Catalonia Ramblas, with hope that we chose well. The staff at the front desk were lovely, nice and really helpful. The room was pretty big and roomy. We asked for a baby cot in the room, and still we had enough space for us to fill free to move around... We asked for a quiet room and we got one that faces to the pool, and it did was very quiet and cozy. The two beds were wide and comfortable, and the kettle with the coffee/tea corner and the minibar were useful for us (we eat only Kosher food, so we needed it to storage our own food). The bathroom also was really big with tub and shower as well, large sink and even a little stool (for what? :)). The greatest thing about the bathroom is that it has it own entrance from the little corridor, and not directly from the room itself. We enjoyed the free WiFi as well. And the last-but-important thing: the location is fantastic!!! 2 minutes walking and you're in the center - Placa Catalonia and the Las Ramblas. We didn't try the breakfast or the spa, so we can't express an opinion about them. The bottom line: Catalonia Ramblas was the best choice we could have made!!!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great location, shame about the internet”
Reviews.Author: tonytone1
Reviews.Content: 4 nights on business for the Mobile Wrold Congress. Definately the most friendly and helpful staff of any hotel in Barcelona I've stayed in. Location very central and convenience for the Fira (3 stops on the metro) and Gaudi's catherdral (4 stops). Breakfasts were excellent too. Rooms lacked draw space (business hotel for 1-2 nights perhaps)? No ability to borrow/use an iron, only an ironing service which is no use when on a business trip. Biggest bug bear was the flakey internet service - essential for a business traveller. Oveall would still give this hotel 4 out of 5. Prices were sky high bur so are all hotels in Barcelona for this particular week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AaronMandel
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The location is just a few blocks off the Ramblas in one direction and several Gaudi buildings in another. The staff is outstanding, speak English and could not have been better. The restaurants are very good.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST thing about Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: sralala
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a Double Superior room at this wonderful hotel in Barcelona, and was truly impressed by the quality of the hotel and its superb personnel. From the moment we arrived, the staff made sure our stay was perfect. There were always at least one or two attendants at the front desk who spoke perfect English. The room was gigantic by European standards, and the difference in price between a standard Double and the Double Superior was nominal, and well worth it. The bathroom was huge, with a luxurious shower. The hotel's free wifi access was easy to use and worked very well. The location was absolutely perfect - surrounded by plenty of shops, restaurants and access points for the Metro, and yet just far enough (around the corner, literally a 2 minute walk) from Las Ramblas that we felt completely safe and secluded from the chaos. Every employee, from the front desk staff to the bartenders to the room service attendants to the housekeepers, was incredibly friendly and helpful. This hotel far exceeded my expectations for our stay, and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Astroboy2011
Reviews.Content: I use this site a lot and thought it was about time I posted something to help other travellers make decisions. My friend and I have been travelling Europe for 6 weeks and have been staying in many hotels. To be honest, this was a last minute booking - like when we arrived at the airport in Barcelona. I booked it online and we got the shuttle bus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is about 100 meteres from the bus stop and literally around the corner from Las Ramblas. I was suffering from a seriously bad man flu and was in no mood to be fussing around. Thankfully, we arrived and apart from the receptionist taking his time to get to us it was all plain sailing. The hotel was a bit cold, I tried to increase the heating by raising the thermostat, but it didn't seem to work. The bed was like sleeping on a rock. It was so hard I thought I would have pressure sores when I woke up. The decor was relatively new and tasteful (marble and wood). The room was small, but then again we managed without a problem and so I would say it was adequate. This is not a new building either and one should consider that older hotels, although renovated, generally tend to have smaller room sizes. I think we got value for money and the location is excellent. I would definitely recommend this place to a mate. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “the most friendly staff and best services ever”
Reviews.Author: minty77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel around october 2010. The people at the hotel were so friendly and the location is perfect near everything walking distance. They recommended excellent restaurant which was so greatly priced and awesome food. The room was super clean and the best of all, the staff were so friendly and the service was great. Everything was great about this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anybody. One of the best hotels I stayed in barcelona. I stayed in hotel soho about a year ago and this hotel is far better than that hotel and the people make the whole difference. I loved our stay at this hotel. It is quite in the rooms and everything was perfect. They also give free wifi which I found very convenient. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Cath-7
Reviews.Content: What an ideal place to stay! Journey from Girona airport by bus to city centre was very easy...follow the crowd upstairs to taxi rank and trip to hotel cost about 10 euros...well worth it when arriving at night. Step out of the hotel, turn right, walk about 50 metres and you are at the top of Las Ramblas... with the metro and tour buses so close by you could not be staying anywhere more central! Metro is also very easy to use...air-conditioned and clean. The hotel and rooms were very comfortable and having a kettle to make tea and coffee was super! At night it was so quiet it was hard to believe we were only round the corner from Las Ramblas but you could not hear a thing! My husband and I celebrated our Silver Weddding Anniversary at the beginning of our stay and although I had mentioned it to the hotel before our arrival we were not expecting to be given a magnificent roof top terrace room for our special night. It was a lovely surprise! We would love to come back to Barcelona again and would definitely return to this hotel. Edgar at the reception desk was always happy to help with any questions or requests which made our stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: girl014
Reviews.Content: while this hotel is located in a great spot close to La Rambla, i was very disappointed with our stay there. the service of the staff from front desk was poor and they were in no way warm and welcoming. our credit card ended up being charged twice for out stay at the hotel. i have contacted them on numerous occasions and still no solution to our problem. i could not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mijw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Catalonia Ramblas from 3rd Nov to 6th Nov. This is a good hotel in a great location only a short walk to the famous Las Ramblas & the lively Placa de Catalunya. We had a double room which was spacious & comfortable. We also had a pool view. The breakfast was excellent. All staff were efficient & helpful. The only complaint we could make was that we could not open the bedroom window,however the air conditioning was good. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location...maybe just a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: rbrb2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Catalonia Ramblas and we LOVED it! We upgraded to a superior room which had a small private balcony that we used A LOT. It was a bit expensive though. However, if you can afford it I would recommend the upgrade. The location was superb! Starbucks was right across the street and Ramblas was only a short and safe walk from the hotel. The train station was just down the block. One thing that we were disappointed in was that the hotel offered free wifi but we were unbale to log-on to thier system. Thank goodness for Starbucks across the street that had free wifi and we had no problem logging on there. The hotel also had a business center (2 computers and one printer). The printer was out-of-order the entire time we were there and you had to pay to use the outdated computers. So again, we were thankful for Starbucks right across the street. The rooms were spotless! We loved the wood floors and the shower was exceptionally large for European standards! It was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and spoke excellent english which was a blessing for us. They were most definitely professional in every sense of the word but just seemed to lack that "personal" feeling. However those were small things and if we ever go back to Barcelona (which I hope we do) we will save our $$ and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good hotel, perhaps a bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: gilevi74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during the end of September until the beginning of October 2010. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much. The weather was great so the pool had sunbathers every day. We got in to Barcelona at 6:30AM and arrived at the hotel at 7AM, and the staff were very pleasant and allowed us to check in to the room at the early morning since the room was available, without any extra charge. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, and at this great location we preferred to eat out as the food in Barcelona is great and we don't typically appreciate hotel food. The bed was enormous and springy. The bathroom and shower were large and very pleasant. The room was clean and the furniture comfortable. The hotel Wi-Fi was available free all over the hotel area, although you need to accept the terms of the service through the browser and put in the user and password every time you connect, which is not that convenient for the mobile phones - but as long as it is free we could hardly complain. The only flaw in the room was that the TV was very small. We paid ~230 Euro per night, mainly because the weekend prices were ~300 Euro per night, and this was excluding breakfast. As we wanted a great location and a 4 star hotel we were willing to pay the price and we enjoyed it very much. If you want a 4 star hotel at a great location this is the hotel for you. Gil

Reviews.Title: “Fair To Midlin”
Reviews.Author: Edgemont2
Reviews.Content: Located on a busy street leading to Placa Catalunya, this hotel does an adequate job of shelter but no more. While the hotel room was acceptable and the bathroom was more than acceptable, the room lacked storage space, a waste basket and there were no tissues in the room. The desk staff was professional but lacked the warmth that better hotels foster. The exercise room consisted of a non-functioning treadmill and two stationary bikes. Two metro stations were within a two block radius and the Ramblas (for better or worse) was also two blocks away. Having stayed on this vacation in comparably priced first rate hotels in Madrid and Lisbon this hotel did not compare. While the hotel had free wi-fi, the business center computers were not free.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ReichenbachManor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to beautiful Barcelona. The Catalonia Ramblas was a lovely hotel - well appointed, very clean and modern rooms. We stayed in a standard double room on the ground floor. I was pleasantly surprised by the fantastic shower, general cleanliness and size of the room. Not a drop of noise was heard from the street below, so quiet was the room. The bed was a king, but I must admit was terribly uncomfortable - hard as a rock. The only other fault I found with the room was the blanket - one of those uncovered, fuzzy, never-washed kinds. But I certainly would return to the hotel, and even request the same room. Breakfast was perfectly adequate with eggs cooked to order, and lot of fresh squeezed juice. My husband and I both visited the spa - I was disappointed to discover that both wet and dry saunas were "broken," but got a lovely massage. Location is perfect - central, right next to the metro, within walking distance to the Gothic Quarter, the boqueria market, and the super-touristy Ramblas (avoid). I heartily recommend the Catalonia Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “OK, just not for us”
Reviews.Author: bklynbiker
Reviews.Content: We were sent here by a sister property, which we had chosen with great care and research only to arrive and be told we had been 'rebooked.' They took pains to point out this property was a 4-star hotel. Needless to say we got one of their worst rooms, a low floor, no view, dark, and small (I checked the floor's room plan on the door..). It's a large, fairly impersonal hotel on a VERY busy city street, packed with roving youths, shoppers, workers and tourists. Just what we DIDN'T want. Worse, no in room filter coffee (instant only -- INSTANT?), NO place to store clothes apart from a closet with hangers (no wardrobe , dresser etc, or even shelves. Huh?), no iron (not an issue but this is supposed to be a 4-star). And the sad instant coffee wasn't even replenished after our first night. The pool /deck area was nice, the common areas OK but again, crowded with tourists and businesspeople attending conferences etc. Everyone raves about the location. If you want to be literally ON a busy thoroughfare, instead of a quiet street 'near' the central sites, then maybe it would be for you.

Reviews.Title: “very peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: fidelina55
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for a long weekend with our kids and had a great time. The location is amazing. In Barcelona parking is a hussle so if you are right in the center of the city is easier with kids to take the tram or walk a bit. The stuff was very friendly and everybody seems to love kids. You are very close to most of the tourist atractions from this point.

Reviews.Title: “No better hotel in Barcelona. Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt89898
Reviews.Content: For price, location, size of room, cleanliness you can't get any better. The location is superb right of the main street. The room was huge with a bathroom double the size of most bathrooms and all black and white marble. The pool at the hotel was great and the staff we so helpful with finding a restaurant and tourist information. Very helpful with storing bags and other queries. Very difficult to review as it was faultless. Amazing stay and super hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: marcolet
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Catalonia Ramblas hotel. Hotel is in a great location - just off Playa Catalyuna. Two metro station close by which gave easy access to all the sights. Room was a double room on the third floor - we had a balcony overlooking a side street which was nice and made the room more spacious. Spacious bathroom with separate shower and bath. Room a little "tired" but fine - flat screen tv, mini bar, tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was in the basement - room itself would not encourage you to hang around for too long. Breakfast was fine - fruit, juices, bread, some hot food and eggs done on request, yogurt - we were just after spending a few days elsewhere and had been spoiled with breakfast choice so maybe not fair to compare! Pool area was small but we always manager to get a lounger - there are only about 12/14. Pool is not really for swimming but is nice to cool off in - about 1 metre deep. Taxi from hotel to airport was €25. Hotel could not give a late check out but they kept our bags and allowed us to use the showers in the spa area. Hotel is not luxurious but it is fine and great location. The pool is also a great advantage and the fact we had a room with balcony. Plenty little bars around the hotel and places to eat. Just off reception computers available for internet use - coin operated - minimum use €2 Overall enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Ice-traveller75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Catalonia Ramblas for one week at the end of July 2010 with my family. This was actually my second time at the hotel in three years, since I also stayed there at the end of September 2008. To get straight to the point, I give this hotel two thumbs up! It is perfectly located (just a couple of minutes walk to the Catalonia Square and the Ramblas), it provides good service to its guest’s, the hotel has a small swimming pool and a sitting area in its backyard, the staff is helpful and friendly and cleanliness is in general good. Of course you can always find some minor items to criticise but in my case they might include items like that the area around the lobby bars need repainting and a handrail from the bar area to the first floors needs to be fastened. I will definitely stay at the hotel the next time I’m in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “bad service!”
Reviews.Author: feribeh
Reviews.Content: the hotel is old, and the room facilities aren't good such as refrigerator,hair dryer, etc., but the room is spacious and clean. towels and sheets are old, there are not enough towels in the room, and the price of breakfast is unreasonable. after all the hotel actually doesn't look like a 4star hotel. although the location is very nice and good for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic Hotel in Ideal Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt022
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona twice before having stayed in the Duques de Bergara and Petit Palace Opera Gardens, this hotel is by far the best hotel that we have stayed in! It is very modern, spotlessly clean with staff that are very friendly and attentive! The location is perfect for all attractions with it be situated just north of the Ramblas and Catalunya Placa where the nearest metro station is. The rooms are excellent in size having booked a superior room with an excellent pool and sun bathing area also. Wouls highly recommend to anyone visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel in the Las Ramblas Area”
Reviews.Author: Tigerrose88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location, short walk from Plaza Catalonia. Front desk staff friendly and helpful, gives you advise to be careful of the area since it is in the busy Las Ramblas area. Breakfast buffet good as well as the hotel restaurant downstairs. Hotel is clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kat Cruz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in this hotel and found in fantastic. Great location, just off Placa Catalunya where the Aerobus (shuttle bus 5.05 euros) drops/picks up. Convenient for metro, although we had nice walks to Barceloneta beach, Las Ramblas and Gothic Quarter, restaurants, supermarkets etc. Stayed in room 338 which overlooked the street behind, wasn't too noisy, felt like a local. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was big for European standards, had bathtub and separate walk-in shower. Free wi-fi was a little slow, mini-bar, safe, reliable air conditioning, room cleaned everyday! The pool was an OK size, but perhaps needed a few more sun loungers. Check out is mid-day and as we were leaving late afternoon we were able to use their shower facilities in the spa. Would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Belissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Dilorom
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, especially location, it is really close to the main place in Barcelona - the street La Rambla, also it is easy to get to all parts of the city. We have enjoyed the trip and the service that hotel has provided for us, the most welcome person is receptionist Tamara, who is friendly and very polite. Highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Toshenka
Reviews.Content: Very nice service, especially receptionist Lady Tamara, she is very nice person, very helpful and friendly :) Location of hotel is perfect! and if you have some little misunderstandings, she will help you to solve them :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: oberone
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations. It is ideally located in Barcelona for exploring the city, with excellent links to public transport also. The hotel is very modern and clean with very large rooms (perfect for our small family). The staff were very friendly, helpful and multilingual. The pool area of the hotel, although small, was very nice. Dining facilities were also very good, with an excellent breakfast buffet and decent room service menu. The hotel also featured free WiFi access throughout (although I did not test it).

Reviews.Title: “Very good Location & good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sheenab77
Reviews.Content: Very good location & very convenient. We stayed there for 4 nights. The room was very good & large in size, not crammed like a regular europe room. The breakfast was a bit boring. Not too much variety, but ok to go with. The staff was very courteous & thank god they were english speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately Priced Gloom in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead_Heath
Reviews.Content: You might love or hate this hotel. It's located right in the midst of the tourist buzz of La Ramblas and Catalunya Square. It's fairly expensive but only half the price of top places like Casa Fuster and Hotel Arts. Its decor might be described as Soviet Style with a mixture of real and fake wood wherever you look. This gives a very depressing effect. The two restaurants are gloomier than a student canteen. The staff are reasonably friendly but seem depressed and unmotivated. Maybe the decor's got to them too. The breakfast was mediocre with cheap coffee. For our first day's breakfast they had a range of smoothies and one could also have smoothies made to order. The smoothies weren't offered on the three other days we were there though. There's an excellent bakery where you can get high quality, cheap filled baguettes, pastries, etc. just out the back of the hotel. There's also a decent Chinese supermarket for water, beer, etc. at the back of the hotel. Our bed was big and very comfortable. The air conditioning in one part of our suite worked excellently. In the other part its emitted such an awful noise that we had to turn it off. The shower was excellent. There was no bath though. The internet PCs were coin operated and kept going wrong. A real mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, location, staff, rooms, cleanliness and food 1st class”
Reviews.Author: chocolatekiwiIreland
Reviews.Content: a very pleasant stay thanks to the staff at the catalonia ramblas barcelona. the rooms were clean and big with modern decor. staff were friendly and had good english. breakfast buffet was a good start to the day. the location is within walking distance to most tourist areas. buses at catalonia square just around the corner. shops on same street. all round i would recommend and hope to stay again. thanks, murphys, ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Need to raise their game!”
Reviews.Author: dg1036
Reviews.Content: I payed 610 Euros to spend three days and nights at this hotel, but was completely disappointed. Although I was in Barcelona for work, I took my Girlfriend along and specifically chose this hotel for its spa and gym. Problems were. Limited opening times for the spa and when it was open, only half of it was working (No Jacuzzi). The Gym is a joke, despite the website, it is really a box room with a few pieces of old equipment. Oh well live and learn, but however--- Our room was small for the price (no balcony despite being promised) outdated decor with sliding doors (that jammed and covererd the tv) to store clothes. Smelly toilet and shower. Window that was difficult to open. Basic TV channels. The bar is nice with comfy seats, but expect to pay nearly 10 Euros for a gin and tonic. A bit overpriced really. The layout of the hotel is bizarre with a strange, exaggerated stroll down to the restaurant for breakfast. I payed in advance for breakfast, but wish I hadn't. A fair selection of food, but the hot food was limited and not very hot at all. The staff were friendly enough when need be, but coffee was to airline standard only I'm afraid! Over all cleanliness is limited (example of which, were the same crumbs were on the bar furniture from the night before). It took me a couple of days to work out, but this hotel is really only interested in big groups of people or large business conventions. We discovered that the more people checked into the hotel, the better the service overall. Things started to appear that were not there at the weekend like chocolates on the bed at night, fruit and water by the lifts, freshly made milkshakes at breakfast. All very nice, but too little too late. To top it all we asked the male receptionist for a nice area to walk and get somewhere to eat that evening. Took us through a very ethnic part of town. Girlfriend got her handbag snatched! (although this is very common, we have since found out, so be careful) Wrong info given me thinks! A different receptionist booked us a taxi for the airport, but expect the Taxi driver to charge an extra 10-12 euros for this privilege. The meter was already up to 6 euros before we got in and it magically ramped up another 6 when we arrived at the airport. He seemed to know all the staff at reception so this must be the accepted price at the hotel?? I would not recommend this hotel for value for money. If I had payed half the price I would still feel let down and disappointed. This is not a four star hotel!! Couples beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lainey20Blue
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in this hotel this February. The hotel is lovely and it is in an excellent location, just off Placa Catalunya within a 5 minute walk of the stop for the airport bus. We stayed in room 101 and it is a very large room with a terrace. The only slightly negative thing I would say is that the breakfast at Eur15 is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: elsal06
Reviews.Content: Really really nice hotel... The rooms were really big. I was there with my colleagues and all the rooms were large... we liked the spa (it is even free of charge). The wi-fi is free as well but it works really slow. Breakfast was ok.. the best deal about this hotel are the staff people.. They are friendly and always able to help. The hotel itself has good position it is just few steps from the Ramblas and the underground at Pl. Catalunya and Pl. Universitad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some issues which need addressing”
Reviews.Author: Beansley
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now for business. We choose this hotel for the excellent location and also for the layout, which is great for the small event we hold there. The hotel is very modern and is in a great location for the Ramblas and shopping areas. However this year I found the cleanliness quite poor. My tea and coffee service in the room was not cleared one day, and the tea, coffee and milk were not replenished. Also, I ordered room service one evening and the dirty plates etc were still standing outside of my room for the whole day and evening the next day (even though the cleaners had visited). I have to say the laundry service was very good though. It was great to know that we had free WiFi, however the service was terrible. We really needed internet access so it was very frustrating when we could not connect, even in the meeting rooms of the hotel. The hotel does have a "business centre" but it only has 2 pcs and a printer. One of the computers was not working during our stay, and also you have to pay to use these machines (minimum of €2 for 10 minutes).
