The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is very good and the food we had for lunch and dinner was pleasant, however we had a coupls of dietary requirements within our group which the hotel had difficulty in dealing with. The vegetarian alternatives were not good, even though we had informed the hotels days in advance that we had these requirements. I did notice someone else had mentioned the soap was not changed each day, and for me this is a good thing. I find it most annoying when hotels feel they have to give me a new bar of soap everyday as this is just a waste. I commend this hotel for not changing the soap everyday. All in all a pleasant hotel, but it needs to improve it's internet services / business centre if it wants to continue to attract business travellers. Also, cleaning and F&B service standards need to be raised.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MariannePG
Reviews.Content: the fotos on this site are the real deal: it is a great hotel in a very nice location. About the price, i wouldn´t say it is the best, although it is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel- excelent location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlackcat
Reviews.Content: While visiting in Barcelona, we stayed in Catalonia Ramblas for 5 nights. Overall it was a pleasant experience. The room was very spacious and beautiful. The bed was comfy. It was also nice to have a small kettle and variety of teas. The staff was quite helpful and friendly with the exception of the night duty receptionist who was not very polite. In the fist night smoke alarms went off 3-4 times and it was disturbing, the night receptionist told us it was not the hotels fault, but guests' who smoke in the rooms and offered no help. Also the soaps were not renewed completely every day, but on some of the days. However excluding these minor details, it was lovely. The breakfasts were very good. Also the location as very comfortable and great both the public transport likns and for exploring the city by foot. We had a good stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bailyhowth
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful Hotel - stayed 2 nights at the end of March 2009. Got very good deal through 1800hotels.ie Hotel is just off Plaza de Catalunya so in a brillant location. Very comfortable hotel with beautiful tce and swimming pool area - would like to enjoy its facilities in the summer. Rooms were o/s - very very large and the bathroom was super. Staff were very helpful especially when we purchased some of their jewellery which was on display / sale...great idea for those who are only on short break and do not have time to shop for pressie for the GIRL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-great location”
Reviews.Author: lenaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Catalonia Ramblas from 28/10 to 1/1/2009. Our stay in this hotel was really pleasant. The location is perfect, the staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms spacious, clean and comfortable, the breakfast a delight. I have only good things to say about this hotel. I would definately stay there again. If you can choose, ask for rooms 312, 313 or 314.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, fair rate”
Reviews.Author: Alec_Satow
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona without a reservation. Following in my GPS the center direction I found myself in front of Hotel Catalunya Ramblas. I ask a room, they show me 2 rooms, I choose the best after a light negotiation about the price... The reception staff is very helpful, friendly... The hall is very roomy with a very cool design, up-to-date but not cold. The room is excellent, with a view on the pool! We didn't have breakfast, but I suppose it should be great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the great city”
Reviews.Author: LeeBr
Reviews.Content: Great location (just 2 min walk from the Ramblas and 1 min from Cataluniya Plaza and the metro station), large and very nice room, huge bathroom, cofee/tee kit, mini bar, free safe, great breakfast, great team and service. Ask for the rooms from 1st flour and hyer (there are rooms also on the ground flour). Very nice SPA and a good restaurant. Free WiFi all over the hotel. Have a great stay in this great city!

Reviews.Title: “We made the good choice !!!”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravelagent
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona last weekend with a group of 150 people. Check-in was very smooth and quick, staff was very helpful, nice rooms, having a pool in central Barcelona was nice, breakfast was excellent.....there is just 1 thing that i found a tiny bit negative and that was bar prices. A beer for € 5,20 is plain expensive. But there were a few mini-supermarkets around, so... Great place to stay, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel as usual”
Reviews.Author: Healthtravel
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel for business or leisure in Barcelona this is the one for you. The location is perfect, the rooms are well appointed and the service is extremely good. I use this hotel frequently and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Logchopper
Reviews.Content: Excellant location just off the Ramblas, close to two Metro stations and major bus routes. Good sized modern room in a well modernised hotel with plenty of comfortable spaces. Excellant outside terrance area with loungers and other furniture, small but excellant pool. Kettle tea, coffee in the room - not so easy to get your supplies replenished.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SurreyJune
Reviews.Content: hotel is spacious and friendly. Stayed for long weekend and have nothing bad to say about it. Rooms were clean and well stocked, breakfast extensive to suit all tastes in a large and spacious dining room. not enough time to try the pool or spa but maybe next time, as i am sure there will be a next time. Perfectly placed for walking to Ramblas nightlight and ballet -and the square to catch a tour bus around the city. No need for taxis, is all on the doorstep. Walk through medieval city to marina and beach for fab restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotels for couples”
Reviews.Author: barne99
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 4 wondefull days in barcelona during august 2009. We stayed at the catalonia ramblas hotel wuich we found excellnt for many reasons. for more details use the: http://sites.google.com/site/barcelonatoursite/

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff & fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Trottersbar
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Barcelona & I was gobsmacked by the whole experience. This was in no small ways contributed to by the Hotel Catalonia Ramblas. A 30mins bus ride (4.25 euros) from the airport and a 150m walk and we were at the hotel. Situated just off the La Ramlas (about 150m from Plaza de Catalonia) this hotel is situated in an excellent location. We arrived at 11am, well before check in time, but were able get into our room immediately. The staff were fantastic, friendly and their English was perfect. The room we booked was a "standard" and were not expecting it to be anything like what we got. It was spacious and clean, with a mini bar that was not a total rip-off. The ensuite was again very spacious with a massive shower room. We did not have a view or a balcony, but when you are in Barcelona there is no time to be wasted looking out the window or sitting on a balcony, so we did not have a problem with this. The breakfast was as good, if not better, than any hotel I have ever stayed in. A great selection of fruits, cakes, hams, cheese, cereals etc.. as well as a hot breakfast of eggs, bacon, sausages, hash browns & toast. The hotel bar & the terrace bar were everything you needed. The swimming pool and terrace were heaven sent after a days sightseeing in 36C heat. We ate in the hotel restaurant (Pelai Restaurant) one night and it was beautiful and not too expensive. All in all this hotel is first class and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: zia8
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Catalonia Ramblas, and we were very impressed. In fact, we thought the hotel was much nicer than the website made it look! The rooms were huge, the shower was amazing, and our room overlooked the pool. The pool was small but very refreshing and towels were provided!! The beds were a little hard, and that is the only negative thing I can say about the hotel. The breakfast was good as well, and had quite a few hot and cold choices. We found the staff to be very friendly and spoke English very well. Only about a block away from Ramblas, which was so fun and entertaining, always something going on there. Metro is only about a block away as well which was great and a cheaper way to get us to the train station for our next destination. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel location and staff”
Reviews.Author: practicaltourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great with very helpful pleasant staff who all spoke english and helped us in any way they could. The service was very good the rooms are modern spacious and very clean. The breakfast is great with good variety and hot food available. The hotel is in a great location off the Ramblas and near metro and the airport bus stop 300 metres. The bus T1 or T2 costs 4 euro 25 and the last stop is close to the hotel, look for the EL triangle huge shop sign and go up that road the hotel is on the left. A T10 pass is cheaper for multiple trips and can be purchased from a machine in the metro station. The tube system is brilliant with trains air conditioned and very clean. Rooms have small safes and the mini bar is cheaper than the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, clean, modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kazzaEnglandBristol
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from staying at this hotel, after choosing it from the trip advisor before i went. It was more than i expected. Great location a road away from the ramblas and eveything was with in walking distance, a little way if u want to go the beach but an enjoyable 30-40mins with lots to see along the way. The staff were very friendly spoke good english and were very helpful. I asked for a room high up as from previous reads on here i was concerned about the noise from the steet, we got a pool veiw with no street noise whats so ever. The room was really good size bigger than expected. Tea and coffee facilities, modern clean with a huge bed!! good shower to. Pretty perfect really only niggle was we had to pay extra to keep our room a few hrs extra and as we didnt get there till late on our arrival and was requested when booked i think this was abit mean!

Reviews.Title: “Would be worth it if it were cleaner and the staff were friendlier”
Reviews.Author: MizJames
Reviews.Content: Overview: This hotel has very modern decoration (lots of marble tile everywhere) and felt a little cold to me, but my husband absolutely loved the way it looked, so if you like that sort of thing, this may be a good choice for you. The rooms along the back courtyard are very quiet, and the hotel is well-located. Pros: -Excellent location -Excellent breakfast buffet (lots of choices, everything fresh, lots of staff) -Excellent shower (large stall, lots of hot water, great water pressure) -Decent-sized rooms -Comfortable beds -Nice little pool (though very cloudy while we were there because of...???) -Nice little lounge area around the pool, plus a pool bar Cons: -The only channels in English are news, so if you like to watch T.V. you're out of luck. -If WiFi is important to you, be warned the service is spotty and slow. I had more luck picking up the signal of the Hotel Lleo a few doors down, and it was a faster connection too. -There are computers in the lobby, but you have to pay to use them! In a hotel this expensive I don't see why this should be so. Not to mention, they are absolutely filthy (Seriously. One of the screens looked as if it had been sneezed on and I saw it was not cleaned the whole time I was there.) One computer froze up while I was using it and the young woman at the desk seemed royally irritated with me because I wanted help instead of just using the other machine, which was her first suggestion. I tried to explain I had swiped my credit card and was paying for the time ticking away while I waited for someone to help. Finally, after the third person came over and shrugged, I said, "Why don't you just please unplug it and plug it back in" which they did. (I would've done it myself if I could've figured out where the outlet was.) That computer sat broken for the rest of the week I was there. -Staff not particularly friendly or helpful: I hate to base this on one or two staff in particular, but these were young women who worked the front desk most days we were there. I used to work in a hotel and know how difficult it can be, still... One young woman in particular seemed so constantly annoyed with anyone trying to speak Spanish (or even those of us asking politely for English) it made me reticent to approach the desk, Her demeanor changed considerably with anyone who spoke Catalan. I am not one to walk up and rudely demand things, and I personally feel that not speaking the local language puts me at a disadvantage, so I act accordingly. I'm not the type of guest who expects to be fawned over (years of past work in various service industry positions have made me far too empathetic to what the staff have to go through) but I do expect staff of a hotel this pricey to at least be civil, if not friendly. Not to mention, fully half or more of the guests spoke either Spanish or English, so it seems the staff should be prepared and not angry about it. I don't need hotel staff to be overly accommodating or to be my friend, just polite would do! -Cleanliness lacking: They say never look under a hotel bed, but I dropped something a few days into our stay, and when I bent down to look for it found fingernail clippings (which were not ours!) along the wall under the bed. YUCK. These had been under the bed the whole time, and indeed, stayed there the entire week. While the linens were changed daily, and sheets seemed spin 'n' span clean (thank god) the rest of the maid service was sorely lacking. During he first shower I took, as the steam fogged everything, I noticed soap scum up the walls and glass shower door. I also owned a small cleaning business once upon a time, and know if you merely wipe down the smooth tiles or glass doors with some regularity, you don't get that sort of buildup. The walls and shower door had obviously not been scrubbed in a while. Worse were the long, dark hairs that began to accumulate on the white tile bathroom floor. They weren't ours (I am a short-haired blond, my husband's head is shaved). I thought, "Are those from the guests before us?" Then as the days wore on and more accumulated, I thought they must be from the cleaning staff (or had they been on the unvacuumed floor and we tracked them in. Bleah.) The thing is, more were brought in, as the original hairs also remained. Obviously the floor was not given even given a cursory sweep during our whole visit. All I could think was if things this obvious were not attended to, how dirty was the rest of the room? The black tile floor? The sink? Ew. We just kept to the bathmats, and tried not to touch the shower walls. If the bed linen had given me any pause, we would've canceled the rest of the reservation and found something else, but as it was, it was easier to stay. The worst part was after a couple days interaction with the staff, I felt it was just easier not to mention the poor maid service, as I felt staff would certainly not be sympathetic, and probably nothing would change anyway. It really wasn't worth the trouble. Overall impression: This place would be an excellent value if the staff were just even the smallest bit warm and the rooms were cleaned properly. I don't want to give the impression it's a pit or anything, it's just...come on! Sweep the bathroom floor every third day for crying out loud! I'm pretty sure we won't be back. Note: We stayed at the Hotel Jazz on our last trip and found it clean, well located, reasonably priced, and the staff very helpful and friendly. The only reason we didn't stay there this time was that we were part of a conference and several friends were also staying at the Catalonia Ramblas. Also, the Jazz is right on top of a metro station and in some of the lower rooms you can hear and feel the trains as they pass. I was worried we might not get into a higher room, because I was booking so late. Next time I'll book early and book into the Jazz.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: francky88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days with my wife at the hotel. It is well situaded, right in the heart of the city. You can walk to every place from here. Rooms are clean and quite big. People from the staff are friendly but i was surprised when i asked one of them to show me where the hotel is on the city map and he could not do it precisely. The beakfast is ok but sometimes you wait too long for coffee to come (and they don't like if you go take it by yourself:) I was suprised too that when i asked to borrow an iron and a table to iron my shirts. They told me they don't lend thoses things and that i should go to the store and buy one LOL Anyway we had a good time in this hotel and Barcelona is a great city. Franck

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: CathyBJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: I've tried a number of hotels around Catalunya Square and this is the best value & location for me. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, although the front desk is a little slow - I did arrive at the same time as another large group, though. Request a room facing the pool or the back street if possible as, like other hotels, the rooms facing the main road can be noisy. If you're there in summer you will not want to leave the pool area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarigoldToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a prime location, right at the top of Las Ramblas. Easy to walk to many things. Very chic rooms, clean lines. If your looking for cosy this isn't the hotel for you. Would stay again. Was about 35Euro's to the aiport from hotel for 4 people and lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: wosk
Reviews.Content: In barcelona the best location for the hotel stay would be Ramblas street, but all the hotels on that street would be costly. This hotel is very very near to the ramblas street and also economical. The hotel, apart from good location, has good rooms and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotell in central Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Marten_Markstrom
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had a lovely weekend at this hotel. The hotel is realy central, near Ramblas and . We got a room against the pool area (great to relax by the pool in the afternoon). The room was realy quiet, we could sleep with the windows open! Great large bed, and double doors to the hallway. The design of the room was realy modern and the breakfast was the best! We would recomend this hotel to oue friends...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Patrick002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently for 3 nights and had a great time. As mentioned in previous reviews, the location is excellent as you're only about 2 mins walk from La Ramblas and directly opposite a bus stop for the open-top tour buses. Our room was very spacious with a huge bed that was very comfortable. The cleanliness of the room and the hotel in general was excellent and the staff were all very friendly. Although we had an potential issue on the second day when they asked us to move to another hotel (I believe because they had over booked for the weekend) but once we explained that out trip was a birthday treat for me and we would prefer to stay, they very quickly agreed. The reception were understanding and professional when dealing with our situation. The hotel also has a reasonable sized outdoor pool that was great for unwinding after a day's sight-seeing. Would definitely recommend this hotel for both couples & families who want to have a central location for their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scooter010
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel 4 nights, two adult and two children. The location is excellent, near Placa de Catalu?a, two Metro stations and in the top of La Rambles. The Staff was kindly, helpful and very efficient. The rooms are huge, modern and equipped well. We strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab rooms and lovely spa”
Reviews.Author: Gordie12
Reviews.Content: We payed £330 for 3 nights. Hotel in the middle of the action, room was huge with a great big bed, shower which would fit at least 4 in it (not that we did!) It rained on Thursday but we spent time in the spa and had it to ourselves which was great. Cleaners were a little eager but you can't complain at that, the rooms were spotless! Ask for room 313 as it was quiet and overlooked the pool

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but isn't 4* worthy”
Reviews.Author: nymbusgirl
Reviews.Content: We were kindly checked in early - we had just come to put our bags into storage but our room was ready which was great. The rooms are nice and the bed is fairly comfortable. It is also very clean. The temperature of the shower fluctuated from scalding hot to cold without touching the taps. And there is mold or green stains on the ceiling. They have been doing renovations one or two rooms over from ours all week - which included a lot of hammering and upon calling the front desk it seems they are knocking out old showers. --- why they put us on the same floor i have no idea?! They sounded really put out that I should complain.... For "soundproofed" rooms it was definitely disappointing. The rooftop pool has beautiful chairs and loungers next to it - that don't get sunlight! The cleaning staff are very determined to clean the room -- which is great until they knock quickly and open the door immediately. Once they just opened the door without knocking --- I was very concerned as I could have been getting dressed!!! Even with the do not disturb sign on the door they came in to try and clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good news - bad news”
Reviews.Author: DaddyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Bad news was when we checked in we were told the entire floor was flooded so they had no rooms [i am not sure i believed the front desk] Good news was they moved us down the street to the CATALONIA DUQUES DE BERGARA hotel and had a fantastic room and complimentary breakfast for the same price. It was a four **** hotel. The hotel was in a great location and we got an interior room so no view but very quiet. Also, the bus to the airport is across the square and only cost 4.75 euros each instead of 15 euros each plus a euro a bag for a taxi...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: sasaglo
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel for only one night, two adult and one child; room exellence at fifht floor, no roumors. Breakfast expensive but favoulose....for one day is possible. In center of city and near the metro. Gloria

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast to die for”
Reviews.Author: SwedeLisa
Reviews.Content: I and my partner stayed at this hotel for Easter 2008. It is in a good location, on a side street at the top of Ramblas. So you get a little peace and quiet, but right next to the hustle and bustle. Walking distance to most things you would want to see, and there are a lot of nice bars in the quarters behind the hotel. Liked: The breakfast, the room and the location. Disliked: The restaurant, the unhelpful snotty staff and the big screen tv in the (very expensive) bar area. In total: Was I happy with it? Yes. Would I go back? If I got a good deal. Breakfast was truly fantastic. Different gorgeous breads and cheeses, yoghurts, cereals, cooked "English breakfast" buffet, great omelettes made to order, Spanish cake selection. It was a feast! And the breakfastroom itself is roomy, quite elegant and never felt crowded. And still- what I can recall best is grilling a piece of "rustic" bread in the toaster, putting on fresh tomatoes, and a little drizzle of olive oil. Hard to beat. The room was really nice. Very stylish- striking bold colourscheme, clean but also I suppose some would say smallish. Only a frosted glass door to the bathroom, which in our room was next to the bed. Again- very stylish, but not what you would want if you are on your first trip away with a romantic partner. The lobby area was also stylish and modern, with a bar. But the drinks were dear- and remember you can get lovely wine for next to nothing in any little bar only around the corner. And there was a huge flatscreen with sport on all the time, which totally ruined the classy and relaxing atmosphere. The staff were rather snotty, and could only be bothered to point in direction of the hallway with lifts to show us where our room was. Not very serviceminded. The restaurant at the back of the hotel was expensive, with bad tasting food (Surprising, considering the breakfasts were supreme.) and slow service. Do NOT try it. But do try the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nancyr_ri
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel in a great location near Placa de Cataluna and La Rambla. Staff were efficient and polite. It also includes a very good full breakfast as part of the cost of the room. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel08
Reviews.Content: The concierge who helped us with our bags upon arriving did not help with our bags at the car and when he delivered them to the room had a grimace on the whole time. When we thanked him, he mumbled his response. Apparently unhappy about something. The room stunk of cigarettes even though it was a non-smoking room. The room was always hot even when we adjusted the thermometer. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. The very strong scent of cleaning products (to cover up cigar and cigarette odor?) was very irritating to our sinus allergies. In the lobby and hallways and room. No facial tissue or wash cloths in the room. The pool is set in a back courtyard, where people from their apartments can look down over you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRose_AL
Reviews.Content: Travelled as a couple for a short break in Barcelona. The hotel is in an excellent location, in the triangle at the top of Las Ramblas. The hotel is between Universitat and Place Catalunya Metro stops which get you to all the tourist sites in the City. We arrived late in the evening and check-in was quick and efficient. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite and expecting our arrival. I emailed the hotel which is part of the large Catalonia hotels group a day before travel to confirm the booking, they responded quickly with a reservation number. The hotel room was modern, very clean and standard to a 4* hotel. The rooms were cleaned daily with all the toiletries and towels replaced for fresh. The toiletries were a wide range and the bathroom also included a hairdryer. The room had no view as it was to the rear of the hotel but on the plus side it was extremely quiet, anyone who has been to Barcelona will tell you how noisy the city is on an evening. The hotel has a SPA with steam room and Sauna, this are all included in the booking price The hotel bar was relaxed and modern but very expensive; I am not one for eating in hotels so this was not a problem to us. There are hundreds of Tapas bars, restaurants and ice cream shops nearby. People will try to scare you with the possible dangers of Barcelona, more so to the south of Las Ramblas 'El Ravel'. We saw no such problems and the hotel is in a safe area next to all the tourist amenities, department stores and transport links. I booked through easytobook.com and got 4 nights for £290 which was a real bargain. If I could get the price again I would without doubt book the Catalonia Ramblas again. I would recommend this hotel to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Horror - The Worst Hotel in The World”
Reviews.Author: Jetset7777
Reviews.Content: This is truly the worst hotel experience I have ever endured. I travel frequently and reside at hotels globally, and have to say I have never been had such a horrific experience. Interestingly enough, I didn't have the time to check Trip Advisor before my trip, and if I had I would have read negative experiences which paralleled mine. The staff is abusive, negative, and misrepresented the price on the hotel room. Not just one staff member, many representing many different shifts. Carolina and Federico were just two of the staff members who truly RUINED what was the most amazing trip to Spain. Their behavior was almost sociopathic in their disdain for hotel guests and guest experience. A question regarding the rate of the room provoked Federico to threaten to call the police and report us to authorities over a 15 Euro difference. The hotel rate online as we booked was 90 Euros. He charged us 105 Euros. It wasn't the money, it was the principle, and the way we were treated was HORRIFIC. So, just for verification, we did pay the 105 Euros, but again, for us, it was about the principle, not the cash. I could go further into detail, but will tell you this was one of many abuses by the hotel staff that made our stay truly TERRIBLE. You can also read some of the other negative reviews on this website and find that they are all true. This is a terrible hotel, the worst staff, and the most horrific service I have every experienced. Please feel free to contact me for further verification or questions regarding this "Horror of a Hotel." If you would prefer to be threatened, abused and experience terrible service, Hotel Catalonia Ramblas in Barcelona is the place to be. My advice... there are many nice hotels in Barcelona, and this isn't one of them, so book yourself somewhere else where the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “SUPURB 4 DAY BREAK”
Reviews.Author: beamoSuttonColdfield
Reviews.Content: Booked this breakvia the Internet and used Travel Republic.Co.UK. The Hotel was suburb arrived via Ryan Air to Gerona,smooth transfer and room available on arrival at 11am The location is suburb just off the Las Ramblas and only 100 yards from the Square,Metro and Open Top Bus departure. The hotel was fantastic and the Spa facility very welcome after a day around the city. We stayed in room 115 on the first floor,still trying to work out the Hotel lift system!!!. We used a restaurant 100 yards from the hotel called L Oliva on 2 evenings,it was great quality and value 40 euros for 2 courses and a bottle of red(2 people). The best city I have visited and the hotel just made the break,breakfast was of a high standard and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: kiwicmc
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the other reviews, but our experience at the Catalonia Ramblas was very positive. For starters, the location is just brilliant, right in the middle of everything, handy to the Metro and only 15 Euros by taxi from the airport. We were on the ground floor but at the back of the hotel - so no view, but the room was incredibly quiet and very dark when the curtains were pulled. Our room was very comfortable and VERY well equipped with lots of unusual but thoughtful touches like individual small reading lights (as well as bedside lamps), plugs in the sink (unusual in Europe), coffee and tea making equipment with a kettle to boil water (also unusual in Europe - and with a good assortment of herbal teas), free WIFI and even bathroom scales. The only thing I didn't particularly like was the funny long pillow, but that's not uncommon in Europe. Everything was very clean and worked fine - the air conditioning, the safe etc. The reception staff were a little offhand when we checked in but later I needed their assistance to make some phone calls in Spanish for me and Carolina on Reception was extremely helpful (including making a long distance call for me that I was never charged for). We arrived at 2pm (check in time) and had a 15 minute wait for our room to be ready - no big deal. There is a huge amount of seating in the lobby/bar area, as well as outside by the small pool on the second floor. We didn't use the pool as the water was not warm enough when we were there. I booked our stay via the www.wotif.com website and we paid only 138 Euro per night - a bargain for this room in this city. I'd definitely recommend the Catalonia Ramblas and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service From a "Four-Star" Hotel Ruins a Trip”
Reviews.Author: starlight06
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is sometimes called a "four-star" hotel, this was the worst hotel stay I have ever endured. The customer service ranged from lacking to actively insulting. After having to deal with (1) rude and unhelpful customer service, (2) a lost reservation, (3) broken air conditioning, and (4) a lying front desk attendant (even the reception manager admitted that the front desk attendant had lied to me), I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. *LOST RESERVATION* The first problem was that when I arrived at the end of a long trip from Valencia, I was told by the attendant at reception (Quentin) that he was unable to find my reservation. After about five minutes examining the list of reservations, I asked Quentin whether there was a problem with my reservation. I handed him my printout of my hotel reservation confirmation (I made the hotel reservation directly on the hotel website). Quentin curtly responded that there would be no problem, but for the fact that they did not have my reservation in the system. He then tried to send me to another hotel down the street. However, it was late at night at this point, and I was exhausted, so I asked Quentin if he could find a room for me. I had my reservation in hand, so it was clear that I was not in the wrong. After making a few phone calls to some other hotels, he finally assigned me to a room in the hotel. I asked Quentin how he was able to find another room. He snidely replied that he was only able to do so by taking a room away from a later-arriving customer, so he would have to deny them a room. I also explicitly confirmed with Quentin that the room he had assigned me to was the room that I had indeed contracted for. He responded, "Yes, and this room is even superior to the other room." *BROKEN AIR CONDITIONING* When I arrived in my room, I was dismayed to discover that the air conditioning didn't appear to be working, even though I specifically booked the hotel because it said that it had air conditioning. After calling guest services, I was informed that I should turn on the air conditioning, and wait 15 minutes before calling them back. So I called - and was told that I would be called back in 15 more minutes. After waiting for far more than 15 minutes, and having received no call, I finally called back. And called. And called the front desk. And called. Until I finally got through - and when I spoke to Quentin at the front desk, he seemed totally unsurprised that the air conditioning wasn't working, and simply told me that there was nothing the hotel could do until the next day. Now, this was the middle of summer, and it was swelteringly hot in my room. I was forced to open the windows because it was incredibly hot. Even then, the room was still very hot, and because of the loud street noise consisting of rowdy partygoers that persisted until at least 5 am, I could not sleep at all that night. I had a full day planned the next day, and was exhausted all day because of my lack of sleep. *RUDE RECEPTION MANAGER* The next day, I spoke with Carola, the reception manager. When I calmly told her my story, and about how dismayed I felt at my treatment by Quentin, she interrupted my recounting of the incident at least 3 times, demanding, "Are you done?" She actually *ADMITTED* that Quentin had known about the broken air conditioning when he had assigned me to the room. And as for Quentin, she scornfully asked me, "What do you want me to do - ask him to apologize to you because he knew that the air conditioning was broken?" Well, Carola, I entered into a contract for a room with a/c - but your hotel breached that contract my giving me a hotel with NO a/c. Moreover, your hotel representative acted in bad faith by lying to me about the lack of a/c. I was so disturbed by Carola's accusatory attitude of denial that I asked to speak to her supervisor. *UNACCEPTABLE CUSTOMER SERVICE* Throughout this whole situation, I received no apologies from Carola or Quentin. It was only when I spoke directly with the director of the hotel that my concerns about shoddy customer service were even addressed. However, the director of the hotel still failed to make me feel like my concerns about shoddy customer service had been adequately addressed. He kept repeating that he had confidence in his staff, and he did not allay my concerns at having been treated poorly, despite NONE of the problems (lost reservation, broken a/c) having been my fault. Perhaps the hotel director's lax management skills has resulted in the unfortunate attitude with which the staff now treats the customers. I have never in my life complained about the customer service I received in a hotel - nor have I ever had to. Even in the smallest B&Bs I stayed in in Italy, I received service with a smile. I selected this hotel based on the positive Tripadvisor reviews as well as the hotel's proximity to Las Ramblas. However, I cannot in good conscience recommend that anyone else stay at this hotel, nor any of the other hotels in the Hoteles Catalonia group, in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, good location, friendly staff. This hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days for a Barcelona city break. When you first see the Hotel you might think it's quite small but once inside you'll think differently. The staff was nice and helpful and the hotel itself has a a stylish and luxury feel to it. Lot's of wood & marble panels. There is a bar lounge area inside (quite large for a hotel), and on the A-level there's a pool with bar as well. When you stay here make sure you know you way around. There are multiple levels and a second set of elevators that get you to some those. Our room (std. deluxe room) was okay although the bathroom door was located really close to the bed. but the rest of the room was spacious enough. Minibar, an in-room safe (big enough for a laptop), Flatscreen Tv, plenty of closet space are all present in the room. what i particularly liked was the double entree doors so most of the hallway sound is blocked. what I didn't like was that the beds came with a hard mattress. The hotel is located near the Catalonia Square (turn right outside the hotel) and La Rambla (the must-see boulevard) starts right there. all in 5 min radius. Opposite of the hotel is a bus stop for the red-route tourist bus which can take you to all the famous places in the city (get tickets/map at kiosk on Catalonia Square). We enjoyed our stay and we will come back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved almost every bit of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: spongebob80
Reviews.Content: When the taxi pulled up to the hotel, needless to say, it wasn't what I had expected. I was disappointed, but also surprised. I was surprised by the superb location of this 4* hotel. But disappointed, by the size on my first look. But once inside the hotel, I realised that, I had no reason to be disappointed, as the hotel from the outside, was very misleading, when infact, the hotel is really big! We checked in with no problems, even got a free upgrade. Happy days! The room was fabulous, virtually brand new, with all the mod-cons. Oo, I must mention the shower in our room, one of the best showers I've had in a hotel! Lovely and big, and clean. Perfecto! The location of the hotel couldnt be better, right next to the world famous Ramblas, yet, near enough away so that you dont get all of the hustle and bustle throughout the night. As I write this, I am sat in the hotel's reception/bar/t.v area waiting for our time to come before we can fly home. I will miss this hotel, as I think of all the hotels I've stayed in the world, this is one of the best. One thing I should mention, is the pick-pockets along the Ramblas, although that has nothing to do with the hotel, any one visiting the hotel or area should be aware that they need to bare in mind their security during their visit, might I suggest a bag that you can see and not carrying around lots of money or important travel documents The staff are friendly, and polite, and couldnt do anymore to help us. Another bonus, free wi-fi! The instructions said that we'd only be able to pick it up in this area on the first floor, but I have managed to pick up the signal in my room on the 3rd floor and at the other end of the hotel. To say that I am impressed with this hotel would be an understatement. I have already planned my return visit with some friends. Catalonia Ramblas, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: Jinxing
Reviews.Content: This hotel verry bad ,pls do not stay. It Close to ramblas and Other things but service of customer Extremeley Poor. Terrible and cant recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill L
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend break in Barcelona. Despite initial problems with checking into the hotel, we would still strongly recommend it. The room was very comfortable and spacious. I think it is the most comfortable hotel bed ever! My only complaint would be that the rooms didnt seem to be cleaned until evening time, which was very inconvenient, given that this is the time we would have liked to be in the room before heading out for the evening. The buffet breakfast selection was second to none. Absolutely fantastic. The location of the hotel was ideal, very central but yet quiet at night when we wanted to sleep. No noise at all. Pool area was lovely and everything was spotlessly clean. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: BindiDerby
Reviews.Content: As with all holidays I was nervous in case I had got a bad hotel as it was a treat for me and a girlfriend for my 40th birthday, I need not have worried, It was fantastic. Yes the reception staff were not overly friendly but they were professional and quick. Hotel is half an hour from airport. Hotel and the room was very clean. Our room number was 239 and the room and bathroom were very spacious, the view is not great but we did not go there to sit in the room. The spa is to die for- again very clean. The pool on the roof is a great bonus the staff at the bar particularly one called Festus was a dab hand at the cocktails! The hotel restaurant is a must - top class meal, but you must book beforehand. You must have breakfast at this hotel, everything is so fresh and the choice is great. The location is cental, you leave the hotel and everything is on your doorstep, we were there for 5 days and did not use a cab. The harbour is a 20 minute walk. The designer shops LV, YSL etc are a 15 minute walk but if you are the kind not to venture too far this hotel is ideal. I would recommend that if you are coming here avoid paying the transfers as it is cheaper to get a cab yourself from the airport. I would defo class this as a 4 star and am planning to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: pet_so
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a somewhat pleasant surprise. I had a spacious room with 2 queen beds, wooden floor, flat screen tv and a big bathroom with separate baththub and shower. The room was spotless and comfortable. The only complaint about the room is the difficulty of adjusting the temperature of the water from the (nice waterfall) shower. It was either very hot or too cold. No bottled water is provided free of charge in the room, but there are plenty of shops nearby to get all you need. The hotel had a small outdoor pool with a pool bar. I didn't try the spa services (sauna, jacuzzi, massage) Breakfast was comprehensive and beautifully laid out. No complaints. Service in the reception varied from standard polite service to somewhat rude and indifferent by one receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: nipperShropshire
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at this hotel in February 2008. The hotel is in a great location - really close to The Ramblas, bus routes and sights. Our room was spacious and beautifully laid out. The bathroom area was great. We stayed on a B&B basis - the breakfast was very good with lots of different things to choose from. You could also have bacon, eggs, etc cooked on a grill whilst you waited. I would recommend this hotel. The reception staff were very helpful. The only very minor downside we found was that we didn't have a good window in our room which meant there was very little natural daylight, however the plus side to this was that our room was located where there was no road or traffic noise. A great hotel, definitely worth a stay in a fab, vibrant city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: O10
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my kids and the room was clean and spacious, breakfast was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billsinc
Reviews.Content: We went to Barca for my wife's 50th birthday and, through Globespan booked this excellent hotel, accounting for the reviews on this site. Arrived, reception were excellent and helpful, porter took bags up to room. There are different shaped rooms in this hotel, we had a big and nicely shaped room. The room was clean, and the maids did a good job. Small balcony outside looked into narrow street. Easy to use safe in the room. Bathroom was roomy, bathrobes provided. Tea and coffee in room. Bed is very wide, I thought very comfortable, my wife thought a bit hard. LCD TV in room, three English speaking channels (BBC world, Sky News and CNN). Hotel recommended a brilliant restaurant to take my wife on her birthdaay (£80 for the two of us inc wine and drinks). Hotel ordered us a taxi on departure - €26.50 to airport inc supllement for bags. Breakfast is great and available up to 11.00am. lots of fruit, cakes, pastries and cooked eggs, omlettes ( with fillings), bacon - all cooked fresh on request. Location is perfect. 50-100m to the top of the Ramblas, Tour bus stop a couple of hundred meters away, though the North tour stops just on the corner across the road from the hotel. Metro stop less than 100m at Universtat. Airport bus only a few hundred meters away. Hard Rock Cafe on the square. Plenty close shopping. I'd stay here again, no hesitation. Barcelona is a great place, we were only there for 5 days, no where near enough time, could easily do a two week summer break in Barca.
